full_summary:
[Government Tender Announcement](#government-tender-announcement)
================================

**Request for Proposal (RFP) Announcement**

The Department of National Defence, on behalf of the Future Fighter Capability Project, is issuing a Request for Proposal (RFP) for a recurring requirement for Information/Records Management/Recordkeeping Specialist services.

**Services Required**

The successful contractor will provide Information/Records Management/Recordkeeping Specialist services with Access to Information and Privacy experience in support of the Future Fighter Capability Project (FFCP) in Ottawa, ON. The services are expected to be delivered over a period of 3 years, from April 1, 2023 to March 31, 2026.

**Security Requirements**

The successful contractor must have a minimum Canada security clearance and be able to obtain a NATO security clearance. The contractor will also be required to protect sensitive documents and information in accordance with the government's security protocols.

**Trade Agreements**

This procurement is subject to various trade agreements, including the World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO-AGP), the Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA), the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA), and others.

**Eligibility Criteria**

Only contractors who are qualified under Tier 1 for the Information/Records Management/Recordkeeping Specialist category under the E60ZT-18TSPS Supply Arrangement are eligible to submit a proposal.

**Proposal Submittal**

To be eligible, contractors must submit a proposal by March 7, 2023, at 2:00 PM (Eastern Time). The proposal must include all required documents and information, as outlined in the RFP.

**Contracting Entity**

The contracting entity for this project is the Department of National Defence, and the contact person is Christian Fry, who can be reached at 343-451-9584 or christian.fry@forces.gc.ca.

[Notice and Documents](#notice-and-documents)
--------------------------------

*   Request for Proposal (RFP) Document
*   Task and Solutions Professional Services (TSPS) Method of Supply
*   Notice of Proposed Procurement (NPP)

**Submission Method**

Proposals must be submitted electronically through the Government of Canada's Tendering System.

**Deadline for Submission**

All proposals must be received by March 7, 2023, at 2:00 PM (Eastern Time).

This RFP is subject to revision and cancellation at any time, and the Department of National Defence reserves the right to award the contract to the highest-ranked
